name: Blanche Barajas
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Mayor Pro-Tem Blanche Barajas was elected to serve the Pasco City Council starting January 2018 and elected Mayor Pro-Tem in 2020.

**Other Professional Experience**  
She currently works for a Not-for-Profit managed care organization and helps those that lack health services.

**Education**  
Blanche holds a bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration and an Associate in Applied Science in Criminal Justice.

**Community Service**  
Blanche Barajas has served as a volunteer, mentor and board member with different organizations throughout the Tri Cities.

**Statement**  
As a Pasco resident and current elected official I am proud to continue serving as a city council member representing not only District 1, but also all of Pasco residents. I am regularly seen volunteering with community-base and faith-based organizations throughout the Tri Cities. As a volunteer for Pasco Areas Safe Community Organization-a group formed by PPD Citizen Academy alumni, I was one of the founders for P.A.S.C.O Hope Pantry. In 2018 I was awarded the Public Servant of the Year award and selected as 1 of 4 Inspiring Latinos for 2018 hosted by Tri Cities Latino Community Network. In my capacity as city council I am proud to say I was part of the workgroup that started the Inclusivity, Diversity and Equity Commission. I work in and for this community and always available to help where and when I can and my volunteer history reflects a small caption of that. I respectfully ask for your continued support to serve and advance our great community.
